intro: Ania borneensis, commonly known as the Borneo ania, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland and hill forests. Ania borneensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
